@graph.title: Routledge handbook of international political sociology
@graph.abstract: Introduction to the Routledge handbook of international political sociology / Xavier Guillaume and Pinar Bilgin -- Feminist theory/gender studies / Laura Shepherd -- Historical sociology / Sandra Halperin -- International law / Tanja Aalberts and Wouter Werner -- International political theory / Anthony Burke -- Postcolonialism and international political sociology / Sankaran Krishna -- The international political sociology of security studies / Can Mutlu and Çagla Lüleci -- Sociology / Prem Kumar Rajaram -- World society / Oliver Kessler -- Citizenship and an international political sociology / Peter Nyers -- Advancing "development" through an international political sociology / Joakim Öjendal and Stina Hansson -- The environment / Hannah Hughes -- Finance / Ute Tellmann -- Feminist international political sociology-international political sociology / Maria Stern -- Global elites / Niilo Kauppi and Mikael Rask Madsen -- Global governance / Ole Jacob Sending -- Health, medicine and the bio-sciences / Alison Howell -- Mobilisation / Lara Coleman and Dörthe Rosenow -- Mobility / Peter Adey and Rachael Squire -- Straddling national and international politics : revisiting the secular assumptions / Jocelyne Cesari -- Reflexive sociology and international political economy / Yves Dezalay and Bryant G. Garth -- Security studies / J. Peter Burgess -- Archival methods / Luis Lobo-Guerrero and Yara van 't Groenewout -- Assemblages / Rita Abrahamsen -- Discourse analysis / Kevin C. Dunn and Iver B. Neumann -- Ethnography/autoethnography/autobiography / Wanda Vrasti -- Learning from the field / Megan Daigle -- History / Halvard Leira and Benjamin de Carvalho -- Learning how to see / Debbie Lisle -- Materiality / Peer Schouten and Maximilian Mayer -- Multidisciplinarity / Roland Bleiker -- Practice / Christian Bueger -- Social spaces / Christoph Houman Ellersgaard, Lasse Folke Henriksen, Peter Marcus Kristensen and Anton Grau Larsen -- Afterword : Transversal politics / Marieke de Goede -- Afterword : International political sociology, or, The social ontology and power politics of process / Stefano Guzzini -- Afterword : the commercial in/for international political sociology / Anna Leander
